titlestmt.titleproper: Berkshire and Columbia Missionary Society records, 1798-2002.
titlestmt.author: William McCarthy

conventiondeclaration.citation: Describing Archives: A Content Standard, Second Edition

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday July 16, 2019 at 17:04

did.unittitle: Berkshire and Columbia Missionary Society records, 1798-2002.
did.abstract: The Berkshire and Columbia Missionary Foundation was a missionary society that was officially founded in February 1798. It is considered to be the oldest missionary society in the US, predating the "Haystack Movement" by eight years. The year prior, members met at the Green River in Hillsdale, N.Y. where it was suggested that a group form to send out missionaries both far and near. The locations that they decided upon included parts of Vermont, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Massachusetts and New Hampshire. By 1810, the movement has ten missionaries who gave out tracts and bibles to help the areas determined to be "destitute settlements". In the two centuries that followed, the foundation donated funds to over 100 different organizations and individuals. The organizations officially closed its doors in 2002. This collection contains meeting and secretary notes, financial information, newspaper clippings, histories, correspondences and programs.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Berkshire and Columbia Missionary Society records, 1798-2002, RG4696. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and processed by Jessica Steytler in December 2012. Re-processed by William McCarthy in October 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Berkshire and Columbia Missionary Foundation was a missionary society that was officially founded in February 1798. It is considered to be the oldest missionary society in the US, predating the "Haystack Movement" by eight years. The year prior, members met at the Green River in Hillsdale, N.Y. where it was suggested that a group form to send out missionaries both far and near. The locations that they decided upon included parts of Vermont, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Massachusetts and New Hampshire. By 1810, the movement has ten missionaries who gave out tracts and bibles to help the areas determined to be "destitute settlements". In the two centuries that followed, the foundation donated funds to over 100 different organizations and individuals. The organizations officially closed its doors in 2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains meeting and secretary notes, financial information, newspaper clippings, histories, correspondences and programs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 5 series and each one is further arranged chronologically.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: Berkshire and Columbia Missionary Society. Oldest Missionary Society in the United States. Massachusetts, n.d.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains meeting minutes, secretary notes, member lists and the constitution for the Berkshire and Columbia Missionary Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains financial information for the Berkshire and Columbia Missionary Society, including treasury records, contributions, transfer of stewardship, tax and bank information and canceled bankbooks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains historical information related to the Berkshire and Columbia Missionary Society, such as newspaper clippings, maps, scrapbook pieces anda history of the society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondences of the Berkshire and Columbia Missionary Society, including those of Albert Nettleton, Kenneth Beckwith, Nehemiah Boynton and more.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains information on the Mission to America and Helping Migrants programs.
